content:
Automatic registration and teaching civics are essential, says David Cay Johnston of DCReport.org

This is the fourth in a series of opinion pieces on how to fix democracy.

VOTING IS the essence of democracy. But how it takes place has always been tricky.

Among the Iroquois peoples in North America, only women voted and only men held office. In the proto-democracy of ancient Athens, voters were divvied up into forced coalitions. In America in the late 18th century, majorities ruled—though only minorities of men were eligible to vote.

Today the franchise is broader. But when large numbers of people fail to vote, democracy is in trouble.

In the British referendum on European Union membership in 2016, around one-third of adults didn’t register to vote, or registered but didn’t bother to vote. In America, only 61% of eligible voters cast ballots in the presidential election in 2016. And just 50.1% turned out for congressional elections two years later—though a mere half of the electorate, it marks a record high turnout for a midterm election.

Low voter turnout is an affront to the idea of majority rule that is the essence of self-governance. Motivated minorities can dominate by getting their supporters to the polls while creating obstacles for opponents.

One problem is voter disenfranchisement. In America, election officials in Florida, Kansas, Texas and other states purged voter rolls using crude algorithms over the past two decades. Repeatedly people with similar names were all thrown off if one person was deemed ineligible. Requiring specific documents to register and photo identification at the polling booth also act as barriers—not too dissimilar to the dubious “literacy tests” used in the 1960s to turn away African Americans. Polling places can be limited or located where people relying on public transport have little or no access. 

The election technology also undermines the franchise. An electronic vote for one candidate can be made to count as a vote for another candidate, either through machine error or malign software. There is good reason to distrust these systems, which the Kremlin has tried to hack.

We can solve these problems. We can do better. But we have to act.

The whole idea of democracy is that we choose our fate instead of handing over governance to a czar, dictator, queen, high priest or warlord. Yet for democracy to flourish, it requires overcoming two natural human tendencies: apathy and ignorance.

It’s easy to skip voting, especially when faced with a long ballot full of unfamiliar names and complicated issues. And showing up to vote without knowledge is irresponsible and, for those with a developed conscience, an act of shame. The good news is that a bevy of remedies are at hand. They include:

* Automatic voting enrollment when each person reaches voting age.

* Voting by mail, as the states of Oregon and Washington allow.

* Holding elections over multiple days instead of on Tuesday—a work-day originally chosen explicitly to bar working men from voting (women didn’t yet have the right to vote).

* Weekend voting and night voting.

* Making election day a national holiday (though this may create problems for state and local elections).

* Using paper ballots, as Canada mostly uses, with tiny, inexpensive radio-frequency identification tags (similar to those used in contactless building passes) and rules to ensure against tampering with ballots.

These changes will go a long way to seeing that the right to vote that exists in theory is upheld in practice. But we need more.

In America, we must restore the teaching of civics. Very few of my students at both the undergraduate and graduate levels have read the American Constitution. Many sit wide-eyed when I bring up provisions they’ve never heard of, like “letters of marque” (letting private individuals plunder enemy ships in wartime) or that there is no habeas corpus right (it is only a privilege). Of course, people who lack even an iota of understanding of government may vote, but they certainly cannot fulfill their duties of citizenship.

One last reform would discourage the renting of politicians by those who profit from government rules and favours. Campaign donations should be limited to people living within the jurisdiction. That way no Californian can donate in a New York election. Only those who will be represented by the winner should be allowed to contribute.

In America, news reports often refer to “the” government, an alienating term suggesting that government is a power unto itself. At DCReport.org, the nonprofit news service that I co-founded and edit, we reject this. Instead, we often refer to “our” government. The difference is crucial. 

It is our government. We own it. We should act like owners and take care of what we own.

___________

David Cay Johnston is the editor-in-chief of DCReport.org, a nonprofit news service, and a visiting lecturer at Syracuse University College of Law. The recipient of a Pulitzer Prize in 2001, he is the author of several books, most recently “The Making of Donald Trump”.

Also in this series:

Matthew Taylor: Citizen deliberation is the gateway to a better politics

Cass Sunstein: Political savagery makes self-government impossible

Audrey Tang: Inside Taiwan’s new digital democracy

过去树林是集体的，“禁闯私人领地”标志会被认为是一种冒犯。 但是，在伯祖母死后，邻居们很快找到了别的地方去打猎、钓鱼、采黑莓和加莱克斯草。

你怎样面对失败？

这将带来资源的浪费，甚至可能会冒犯我们正努力援助的那些人。

If you can, turn that kind of sponsor away - it's not worth the money to  your audience.
要是你有能力，尽量拒绝这样的赞助商，不值得为了钱而疏远你的宾客们。

ex: n. 冷漠，无兴趣，漠不关心；无感情

作为个人发展的对立面，个人退化的核心原则应该是 谎言、冷漠以及无能为力 。
The more you direct your life towards Falsehood,  and Powerlessness, the more you’ll regress in your life instead of improve.
你越是把生活指向谎言、冷漠和无能为力，你的生活就会倒退得越多而不会有所改善。
However, if I talk to them about it, they’re going to feel worse, not better — at least initially — since the path out of  runs straight through the territory of negative emotions.
然而，如果我跟他们讨论起这个，他们的感觉不会变好，而是更糟——至少在开始时如此——因为摆脱冷漠的方法直刺他们内心充满负面情感的部分。

wp.preferential ballot: 选择选举制的选票;偏好投票制

eg2: He has tallied the result of the .
他已经将投票结果记录下来了。
If people paid taxes, then they should be able to vote, since only through the ballot could they prevent the government from abusing its powers and depriving them of their liberty.
如果人们纳税，那么他们就应该能够投票，只有通过投票才能防止政府滥用权力和剥夺人们的自由。
To deny anyone or any group the ballot lessens its importance, for the individual and for the community.
否认任何人或任何群体的投票权，就是降低了选举对个人和社会的重要意义。

ex: n. 一群
eg2: She had a  of outstanding qualities, but her inability to accept a different opinion ultimately led to a breakup.
她拥有很多突出的优点，但是她不能接受与她不同的观点，这一点最终导致了我们的分手。
And not only do my trips to the grocery store promote a  of onlookers. I am bombarded at work and at home about my eating habits.
而且不仅我到杂货店的这段行程会引来一群观看者，我在工作时或者在家里也会受到有关我饮食习惯的的攻击。

你可以访问一组行业网络有利资源， 它们将在市场和销售阶段帮助你定位你的客户群体。

其成员倾向于对网络和公民的参与都充满热情；他们对于把互联网作为解决政治问题的灵丹妙药表示怀疑。
Once these building blocks were in place, other aspects of modernity like democracy and civic participation could be added.
一旦所有这些构件到位，现代性的其他方面比如民主和公民参与就可以添加上去。

As a coalition we need to have clear messages for the Afghan people, and those messages need to be communicated by our deeds as well as our words.
作为一只联合部队，我们需要给阿富汗人民以清楚的信息，这些信息需要通过我们的口头，以及我们的行动传达出去。

如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

The differences in command line tools, output formats, values, and other information all  what should otherwise be a simple process.
命令行工具、输出格式、值和其他信息之间的差异全都会使原本应该简单的过程变得复杂化。

如果不算这些，我的第一个突破应该是写书，那本关于和平队经历的书。

对许多参加服务的志愿者来说，他们在和平队的工作对他们后来所做的一切都产生了影响。
So I elicited the help of an old friend from the Marine corps to expand upon the theme.
所以我从海军部队那里得到我一位老朋友的帮助来详述这个主题。

还可以配置和重新配置消息处理策略，以适应您认为必需的任何数量和顺序的操作。
Some observers expressed their concern that China would use the East Asia Summit to expand its influence in this region. Do you deem the concern reasonable?
一些观察家表示，担心中国利用此次东亚峰会扩大中国在这一地区的影响力，你认为这一担心是否有道理？
And by the way, these high-value points that we deem necessary have already been validated by our customers.
顺便说一下，这些我们认为是必要的高价值点已经被我们的客户确认是有效的。

中国代表团将在会上提出对理事会未来工作的看法和主张，以积极和建设性态度参与各项议题的审议。

但是，新闻媒体也应尽一切努力来保证讨论以文明的方式进行，并阻止传播谎言或对他人的贬义攻击。

eg2: On the one hand I admire his gifts, but on the other I distrust his judgment.
一方面我羡慕他的才华， 而另一方面我却怀疑他的判断力。
If we assume that we have been fed all sensory input via a machine, then we must distrust everything we have ever experienced.
如果假设我们已经被一台机器控制了所有的感觉输入，那么我们必须怀疑曾经经历过的一切。
We can have sex at the other levels, but without that same level of trust the vulnerability of sex may be associated with anxiety, fear and .
我们可以有其他层次的性爱，但缺少同一层次对性爱脆弱性的信任可能带有焦虑、恐惧和不信任。

The process started with a precooked government plan to  up the company between Fiat, a trust fund run by the United Automobile Workers union and the American and Canadian governments.
这个过程开始于政府和菲亚特公司分摊克莱斯勒的计划，美国汽车工人协会和美国加拿大政府控制的信托基金。

她必须控制自己的情感。
They had the ambition to  this small country.
他们有控制这个小国的野心。
Never allow her dominate you in any way, do not buy her drinks or hold/watch her purse for her.
绝对不要让她以任何的方式支配你，不要为她买饮料，不要帮她拿着或看着包包。

ex: vt. 捐赠；捐献

wp.Widgetsoid Donate: 合金控件捐赠版;合金控件捐赠汉化版

我们所能做的就是为他们捐赠一些钱和衣物。
But if your clinic would reassure me that I would not be at risk, then I would happily .
但是，如果诊所让我放心，保证我不会有危险，那么，我将愉快地捐赠。
Dump it all on the floor, make her try on things and give her my honest opinion of how she looks in it, then shift things into a donate pile, Toss pile and be done with it.
把它们倒在地板上，让她试穿每一件并且对于她穿起来怎么样给她我最真诚的意见。之后把衣物分为可以捐赠的一堆，可以扔掉的一堆，把它们了结掉。

organ donation(= allowing doctors to use an organ from your body after your death in order to save a sick person's life)

ex: adj. 可疑的；暧昧的；无把握的；半信半疑的

You burst in on her doing something  and she is trying to neutralise it by involving you.

Title: We can beat the real enemies of the people—those who suppress voter turnout

paperStatistics.title: We can beat the real enemies of the people—those who suppress voter turnout
paperStatistics.desc: Automatic registration and teaching civics are essential, says David Cay Johnston of DCReport.org
